profile.name: Jorge
profile.title: One of the few that loves JS unconditionally (L)
profile.description:
Hello everyone! I'm Jorge and I'm passionate about technology. 

I've been programming and immersed in technology for 14 years. I love learning, working with the latest technologies and being involved in my projects as much as possible. I am addicted to planning, organising and I love to document and develop all my projects with extreme care.

I have worked with most of the typical stacks of a cloud architecture, from frontend frameworks like React.js, AngularJs or VueJs to backend ones; Node.js, kubernetes, docker, mysql, mongo.db...

I specialise in the use of Javascript and front-end development. I started a long time ago working on vanilla Javascript with jQuery and at the moment I prefer a combination of ReactJs and NextJs to develop my applications.

I have also worked in managing the technical team, planning projects, designing products and their architecture, interviewing developers, training them, working on the board as a partner in my own company, and helping with business development and fundraising. 

Of all this, I still love coding, managing small teams and being part of product development from the beginning.

location.notes: Autocompleted using Google Maps API (id: ChIJgTwKgJcpQg0RaSKMYcHeNsQ)

interestingFacts.fact: Crossfit (a lot), Music (a lot also, I play the guitar and now I am playing around to be a DJ), Motorbike (with lot of careful), Ski, Surf, Trek... too many hobbies, I love to try new things
The Who, Led Zeppelin, Foo Fighters, Kings of Leon, Marvin Gaye and a lot lot more!

challenges.description:
Working for Parser Digital (https://www.parserdigital.com/), a consultancy firm within Checkout.com client, a cloud-based payment company platform, in a team that owns two major applications. One that hosts all the services and products offered to the client, and another that provides a template system of tables and formularies managed by JSON objects that are used by the rest of the company's teams.

The role consists of taking the lead on the front-end side of these applications, working on the possible enhancements, refactoring and also the bugs that we may have. 

Our main goal is to refactor and almost completely redevelop the way the two applications work. For the hosting application, the routing system was causing a lot of problems and it was not very easy for the hosted micro-applications to modify it. For the templates application, we needed to refactor the entire client validation system to allow more possible combinations and fix the ones we were already using.

Working for Parser Digital, a consultancy company within the client Checkout.com, a cloud-based platform for payment companies, in a team that owns the design and development of new developer tools.

The role consists of working with a team of three developers and a product owner to analyse what can be improved in the Checkout.com product, what can be added and how we can improve the testing area of the company's application ecosystem.

This team wasn't organised on a client/server basis and we all worked together on both sides as we used Javascript on both sides. As part of the work we did on this project was a big migration of React.Js within Next.Js, a big documentation improvement and the inclusion of a CI/CD testing system for the products they were using.

Leading the front-end side of one of many teams in a project based on moving a large monolithic application developed in AngularJs to microservices developed in VueJs.

My job was to analyse the old application, break it down into micro-applications for the new client, propose a new architecture for each new micro-application, and fully develop and test these new applications. I also worked with the team in charge of the company's UI kit to help them and improve the common components they had for the company's global use.

Aplanet is a startup that develops two products to help companies do their social and environmental aid better, easier and faster.

I joined as Senior Front End Developer to lead the build of their two apps with React.Js and Redux from the two MVPs they already had. I was involved in architecture and process design, product development and design.

Partner in Inevio Inc (Horbito) and one of the original 4 co-founders. A company focused on developing the web operating system, a web that looks and works like a computer. Where you could use your applications with your files, anywhere and on any device.

In this second stage of the company, we raised a $1 million fund and changed the organisation of the development team to smaller teams per business vertical with a more full-stack approach. I led the team that focused on the B2B part of the business, building the tools and technology for that.

Thinking from scratch about what needed to be done, helping to design it from the UI/UX side and designing the code architecture of the new feature. Finally, developing, testing and maintaining the new features. On the server side we worked with AWS, Node.Js, Kubernetes and Docker. For the client side, we started working with vanilla Javascript with jQuery or Canvas on top of it and ended up with the latest frameworks that everyone is using now, in this case trying React.Js.

As a partner in the company, I was on the board of directors, designing the roadmap of the company and helping with any problems that might arise in the business side. So I worked on fundraising projects, travelling around the world to raise money for the company, I worked as a commercial, selling our product via email and in the field, and as a product developer, designing how the product would evolve.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jmxjWbEnJms
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Amauo9XTfqQ

Partner in Inevio Inc (Horbito) and one of the original 4 co-founders. A company focused on developing the web operating system, a web that looks and works like a computer. Where you could use your applications with your files, anywhere and on any device.

In this first stage of the company we started to build this web operative system, building from scratch all the applications needed to fulfil the needs of a casual user. We developed a text editor, a calendar, a file system application, video and audio players and all the rest of the typical standard applications that come with a computer. Our vision for the company was to leave the entire front end open source, as we wanted it to grow with the participation of the user community, so all these applications can be found in the company's repository https://github.com/Inevio.

At the beginning there were only 4 of us and I stayed on as the lead for the front-end side of the application. We started to grow quickly and got to about 12 in the first year. As the front-end lead, I was responsible for designing the architecture for the front-end side, managing the front-end developers and developing the actual standard initial applications for the product.

As a partner in the company, I was on the board of directors, designing the roadmap of the company and helping with any problems that might arise in the business side. So I worked on fundraising projects, travelling around the world to raise money for the company, I worked as a commercial, selling our product via email and in the field, and as a product developer, designing how the product would evolve.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ph7nDKYyaqE

Worked for Accenture on a project for France Telecom on their two e-commerce sites, amena.com and orange.com. In this second stage at the company, as they started to need some more work on the front end, I ended up as their frontend lead, developing some simple pages with HTML, CSS and Javascript with jQuery.Worked for Accenture on a project for France Telecom on their two e-commerce sites, amena.com and orange.com. In this second stage at the company, as they started to need some more work on the front end, I ended up as their frontend lead, developing some simple pages with HTML, CSS and Javascript with jQuery.
Software Development, using ATGv10, Java, Sql, webLogic and other resources.

details.name: IDE Filesystem
details.description:
A simple web based IDE based on a list of File objects. The path where you can find the file data is here: src/defaultFiles.ts. The file data is an array of File objects. Each File object has a path and contents property. The path is a string that represents the path to the file. The contents are a string that represents the contents of the file.

Main Goals
1. Show the files in a nested structure, with separate sections for each folder and file.
2. Make sure the application can handle file structures of any complexity.
3. Arrange the file tree in a specific order:
 3.a Folders should be displayed before files.
 3.b All items should be sorted alphabetically, regardless of uppercase or lowercase letters.
4. Any changes you make to file contents must persist for the duration of the session and save automatically.
5. Include tests in the code.

Secondary Goals
1. Implement a feature to move files to a different folder via drag and drop.
2. Ability to resize the panels (the file tree and the code editor).

manfredSpecificData.desiredJobDescription:
I would love to work in a company with a 'small company culture'. Where all opinions matter and the focus is always on making the best of it. 

I like companies with a focus on one product, where the whole team is involved in the design, growth and development of that product. I love working with and trying out the latest technologies and always working with the best tools.

I love being flexible and working from home, but I also love building a family and getting together with colleagues.

I'm a big fan of video games, music, motorcycles and photography so it would be great if I can relate to that too.
manfredSpecificData.goodPractices:
I understand and apply SOLID, KISS, YAGNI... Personally, it has been difficult for me to find a project in my career where TDD was a priority, although I consider testing an indispensable part of development and I always apply it, both unit and integration testing. 

I am used to working in high performance teams, applying continuous CD/CI and I love cleanliness and simplicity. Last but not least, I'm used to work in SCRUM and other agile methodologies.
